018package org.opengis.util;
019
020import java.util.Map;
021import java.util.Set;
022import org.opengis.annotation.Classifier;
023import org.opengis.annotation.Stereotype;
024import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
025
026import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.*;
027import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.*;
028
029
030/**
031 * The type definition of a {@linkplain Record record}.
032 * A {@code RecordType} defines dynamically constructed data type.
033 * It is identified by a {@linkplain #getTypeName() type name}
034 * and contains an arbitrary number of {@linkplain #getFieldTypes() fields}.
035 * Fields are (<var>name</var>, <var>type</var>) pairs where the type is often the wrapper
036 * for a primitive type or a {@link String}, but can also be another {@code RecordType}.
037 * Field values can be read and written but cannot be added or removed.
038 * This approach ensures that once a {@code RecordType} is constructed, it is immutable.
039 *
040 * <h2>Comparison with features and Java reflection</h2>
041 * If we think about {@code RecordType} as similar to a simple feature (ISO 19109) or a Java {@link Class}
042 * with public fields, then we can establish the following equivalence table:
043 *
044 * <table class="ogc">
045 *   <caption>Equivalences between records, features and Java constructs</caption>
046 *   <tr>
047 *     <th>ISO 19103</th>
048 *     <th>ISO 19109</th>
049 *     <th>Similar to Java</th>
050 *   </tr><tr>
051 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.Record}</td>
052 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.feature.Feature}</td>
053 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Object}</td>
054 *   </tr><tr>
055 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.Record#getRecordType()}</td>
056 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.feature.Feature#getType()}</td>
057 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Object#getClass()}</td>
058 *   </tr><tr>
059 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.RecordType}</td>
060 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.feature.FeatureType}</td>
061 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Class}</td>
062 *   </tr><tr>
063 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.RecordType#getTypeName()}</td>
064 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.feature.FeatureType#getName()}</td>
065 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Class#getName()}</td>
066 *   </tr><tr>
067 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.RecordType#getContainer()}</td>
068 *     <td></td>
069 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Class#getPackage()}</td>
070 *   </tr><tr>
071 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.RecordType#getFieldTypes()}</td>
072 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.feature.FeatureType#getProperties(boolean)}</td>
073 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Class#getFields()}</td>
074 *   </tr><tr>
075 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.RecordType#locate RecordType.locate(MemberName)}</td>
076 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.feature.FeatureType#getProperty getProperty(String)}</td>
077 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Class#getField Class.getField(String)}</td>
078 *   </tr><tr>
079 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.RecordType#isInstance RecordType.isInstance(Record)}</td>
080 *     <td></td>
081 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Class#isInstance Class.isInstance(Object)}</td>
082 *   </tr><tr>
083 *     <td>{@link org.opengis.util.RecordSchema}</td>
084 *     <td></td>
085 *     <td>{@link java.lang.Package}</td>
086 *   </tr>
087 * </table>
088 *
089 * @author  Bryce Nordgren (USDA)
090 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (IRD)
091 * @version 3.1
092 * @since   2.1
093 *
094 * @see Record
095 * @see Record#getRecordType()
096 */
097@Classifier(Stereotype.METACLASS)
098@UML(identifier="RecordType", specification=ISO_19103)
099public interface RecordType extends Type {
100    /**
101     * Returns the name that identifies this record type.
102     * This is similar to {@linkplain Class#getName() class name} in the Java language.
103     *
104     * @return the name that identifies this record type.
105     */
106    @Override
107    @UML(identifier="typeName", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19103, version=2005)
108    TypeName getTypeName();
109
110    /**
111     * Returns the schema that contains this record type.
112     *
113     * @return the schema that contains this record type.
114     *
115     * @deprecated The {@code RecordSchema} interface has been removed in the 2015 revision of ISO 19103 standard.
116     */
117    @Deprecated(since="3.1")
118    @UML(identifier="schema", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19103, version=2005)
119    RecordSchema getContainer();
120
121    /**
122     * Returns the dictionary of all (<var>name</var>, <var>type</var>) pairs in this record type.
123     * The dictionary shall contain at least one entry and should be
124     * {@linkplain java.util.Collections#unmodifiableMap unmodifiable}.
125     * This is similar to {@linkplain Class#getFields() class fields} in the Java language.
126     *
127     * @return the dictionary of all (<var>name</var>, <var>type</var>) pairs in this record type.
128     *         Shall contain at least one entry.
129     *
130     * @see Record#getFields()
131     *
132     * @since 3.1
133     */
134    @UML(identifier="fieldType", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19103)
135    Map<MemberName, Type> getFieldTypes();
136
137    /**
138     * Returns the dictionary of all (<var>name</var>, <var>type</var>) pairs in this record type.
139     * The dictionary should be {@linkplain java.util.Collections#unmodifiableMap unmodifiable}.
140     * If there are no fields, this method returns the empty map.
141     *
142     * @return the dictionary of all (<var>name</var>, <var>type</var>) pairs in this record type.
143     *
144     * @see Record#getAttributes()
145     *
146     * @deprecated Renamed {@link #getFieldTypes()} in the 2015 revision of ISO 19103.
147     */
148    @Deprecated(since="3.1")
149    @UML(identifier="memberType", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19103, version=2005)
150    default Map<MemberName, Type> getMemberTypes() {
151        return getFieldTypes();
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * Returns the names of fields defined in this {@code RecordType}'s dictionary.
156     * This is a convenience method functionally equivalent to the following code:
157     *
158     * {@snippet lang="java" :
159     * return getFieldTypes().keySet();
160     * }
161     *
162     * @return the set of field names defined in this {@code RecordType}'s dictionary.
163     *
164     * @departure easeOfUse
165     *   This is a convenience shortcut for a common operation.
166     */
167    default Set<MemberName> getMembers() {
168        return getFieldTypes().keySet();
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Looks up the provided field name and returns the associated type name.
173     * If the field name is not defined in this record type, then this method returns {@code null}.
174     * This method is functionally equivalent to the following code:
175     *
176     * {@snippet lang="java" :
177     * Type type = getFieldTypes().get(name);
178     * return (type != null) ? type.getTypeName() : null;
179     * }
180     *
181     * This is similar to {@linkplain Class#getField(String) fetching a class field} in the Java language.
182     *
183     * @param  name  the name of the field to lookup.
184     * @return the type of the field of the given name, or {@code null}.
185     *
186     * @departure historic
187     *   This method was provided in ISO 19103:2003 and removed in ISO 10103:2015.
188     *   GeoAPI keeps it for compatibility reasons, since this method can be seen
189     *   as a shortcut to other methods.
190     *
191     * @see #getFieldTypes()
192     * @see Record#get(MemberName)
193     */
194    @UML(identifier="locate", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19103, version=2005)
195    default TypeName locate(MemberName name) {
196        final Type type = getFieldTypes().get(name);
197        return (type != null) ? type.getTypeName() : null;
198    }
199
200    /**
201     * Determines if the specified record is compatible with this record type.
202     * This method returns {@code false} if the given {@code record} is null,
203     * or if the following condition is false:
204     *
205     * {@snippet lang="java" :
206     * return (record != null) && getMembers().containsAll(record.getFields().keySet());
207     * }
208     *
209     * If the above condition is true, it may or may not be sufficient for this method to return {@code true}.
210     * Implementations are free to use more restrictive criteria.
211     * In particular, it is valid to implement this method like below:
212     *
213     * {@snippet lang="java" :
214     * return (record != null) && equals(record.getRecordType());
215     * }
216     *
217     * The {@code containsAll} approach accepts "sub-types" (defined as records with additional fields) in a way
218     * similar to {@linkplain Class#isInstance(Object) assignement-compatibility check} in the Java language,
219     * while the {@code equals} approach accepts only the exact same record definition.
220     *
221     * @param  record  the record to test for compatibility with this type, or {@code null}.
222     * @return {@code true} if the given record is non-null and compatible with this record type.
223     *
224     * @departure easeOfUse
225     *   This method provides no additional information compared to the ISO standard methods,
226     *   but is declared in GeoAPI for convenience.
227     */
228    boolean isInstance(Record record);
229}
